title: Apology Statement Regarding Recent MOD Incident
contents: First and foremost, we would like to offer our sincerest apologies. Our response and handling of the recent issues surrounding certain MODs were neither timely nor appropriate.We recently received multiple player reports indicating that \Scavæ¨¡å¼ 1.8.0]â€‹ (MOD ID: 3600714295) contained abnormal code, which prevented some players from launching the game. Following a thorough review, we have determined that this MOD violates our Creation Guidelines. To safeguard the normal gameplay experience for all players, we have taken action to ban this MOD.We also wish to address this matter with full transparency: Our response in identifying and handling this issue was not prompt, leading to a negative experience for affected players. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and frustration this has caused.To prevent such incidents in the future, we will commit to investigating any reports of MODs containing malicious code or exhibiting harmful behavior towards players within 3 business days. Upon verification, immediate action will be taken. We must acknowledge that we do not possess the capability for pre-release review of MODs; therefore, we genuinely rely on the vigilance and assistance of our community. If you encounter any related issues, please report them promptly through our Discord server or duckov2025@gmail.com. Furthermore, we have revised and strengthened our MOD Guide. All development, publication, and use of MODs must adhere to our Community Guidelines and the relevant Steam Workshop rules. Any MOD proven to harm normal gameplay, save data security, or community order will be permanently removed in accordance with our policies.Regarding our team's initial, informal communication with the MOD creator involved, we have come to understand that our internal decisionâ€”driven by a desire to "minimize the impact on players who enjoyed this MOD"â€”to attempt a low-key, informal resolution at the onset of this incident was fundamentally flawed.We must acknowledge that this approach constituted a serious error in judgment. It compromised our stated principle of "zero tolerance" for malicious code and has disappointed the trust players placed in us. This is also unfair to the MOD developers who have always adhered to the community guidelines in their creative work. For this, we apologize once again.To the Escape from Duckovcommunity, all our users and MOD creators are valued members and deserve our utmost respect. We aspire to work together with all players and creators to maintain a positive environment for communication and discussion. We expect that any issues we face can be addressed through rational and respectful dialogue. We remain committed to upholding community standards and striving to ensure a safe, friendly, and smooth experience for everyone, both in-game and within our community.We extend our sincerest apologies once more and thank you for your understanding and continued support.Escape from Duckov Publishing Team

title: Battlefield 6 has just been dethroned on Steam by 2025's weirdest military shooter

title: I definitely didn't expect Tarkov parody Escape From Duckov to be this good, or this popular
contents: I'm never quite sure what to make of parody games. They're sort of like fanfiction, in a way. There are rare occasions when fanfiction can take off and hit the mainstream, though, matching (or, in especially uncommon occurrences, surpassing) their inspirators. By all accounts, Escape From Duckov is a great game in its own right. The gameplay is a world away from Tarkov, which clearly inspired its name, but players are still flocking to get a piece of its duck-on-duck action. Is it because of the name? Because it's genuinely a fun game? Or do we have a 50 Shades of Mallard on our hands? Read the rest of the story... title: Tarkov-like by name but not by nature, Escape From Duckov is already flying on Steam
contents: If you had given me ten attempts to guess the premise of the first game to ape Escape From Tarkov's name, I'd never have got it. Honestly, if you'd given me 100 attempts, I never would've guessed Escape From Duckov. Yet here we are. Replacing mercenaries with ducks and swapping FPS tension for top-down carnage, it's Tarkov-like by name, but not really by nature. The tongue-in-cheek wordplay and its PvE looter shooter premise has resulted in a surge of players following its launch today, and I'm tempted to check it out myself. Read the rest of the story... title: Answers to Some Questions Everyone is Concerned About
contents: Recently, besides receiving a lot of suggestions from everyone, weâ€™ve also encountered many issues that players have faced. Iâ€™ve compiled some of the most common questions here for everyone to check out. I used translation software, so if anything is unclear, please leave a comment and let me know! About Basic Game Questions Q1: I really want to play with my friends! Does the game include a multiplayer mode? A: Duckov is a single-player game and does not include multiplayer features. Q2: Can I play it on my phone? A: There are currently no plans to release it on mobile platforms... Q3: Does the game support controllers? A: Not at the moment. Q4: Will it support MAC computers? A: The current DEMO version does not support MAC, but the full release will! Q5: Does the game support cloud saves? A: The DEMO version does not support cloud saves, but the full version will. Also, Steam achievements will only be available in the full version. Q6: Will there be a Steam Workshop? A: This is still undecided. Weâ€™ll need to wait until the core development is complete before making a decision. About Major Bugs in This Test Q1: Sometimes, the GPU usage is too high. A: In the future, weâ€™ll add an FPS cap setting. Currently, the cap is 144 FPS, which does put a high load on the GPU. Weâ€™ll also add more graphics settings to meet the needs of more players. Q2: Why is my game screen purple? A: Based on the information weâ€™ve gathered, itâ€™s likely because the game does not support integrated graphics cards. (orz) Q3: If thereâ€™s a power outage or crash during gameplay, the save file will be lost. A: QAQ First of all, we sincerely apologize for this issue. Weâ€™ve received multiple reports about this problem, and unfortunately, we currently cannot fix it. Weâ€™ve roughly identified the cause of the bug and will resolve it in the next test! Q4: Strange map glitches and invisible walls. A: Aaaah, please report these to us! Weâ€™ll fix them as soon as possible! (orz) About Future Plans Q1: When will we be able to play next? A: After this playtest ends, weâ€™ll adjust the game based on the feedback weâ€™ve received. Weâ€™ll open another test during the Steam Next Fest in June! In terms of content, the next DEMO wonâ€™t include new maps, but weâ€™ll optimize the tutorial, improve the quest experience, and address other frequently reported issues. Everything will be optimized!! Around June, weâ€™ll also finalize a release date for the full game. Weâ€™ll definitely deliver it this year! Q2: What will the business model be like? How much will it cost? A: Duckov will be a one-time purchase game with no in-game purchases. The exact price hasnâ€™t been decided yet, but weâ€™ll respect and consider everyoneâ€™s suggestions. Q3: Will the current DEMO save files be compatible with the full version? A: Actually, we canâ€™t deliberately delete your save files (since theyâ€™re stored locally for single-player games). However, because weâ€™ve updated the game, old save files might trigger unexpected bugs. Additionally, in the new version, weâ€™ll update quests, optimize the early-game experience, adjust enemy and weapon stats, add official Steam achievements, and make a series of other adjustments. Therefore, we recommend starting a new save file when the full game is released.
